info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 5 at 8:12AM CDT until July 5 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by earlier excessive rainfall continues.
* WHERE...A portion of south central Nebraska, including the following county, Thayer.
* WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas, along with possibly along some rural county roads and small creeks.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 803 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that much of the Advisory area picked up 2 to 4 inches of rain in a short time earlier this morning, but that rain had long since ended with no additional rain expected today. However, minor flooding likely continues in parts of the area at this time, particularly in the Deshler area where the overall-heaviest rain fell. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Big Sandy Creek, Spring Branch, Spring Creek, Dry Creek and South Fork Big Sandy Creek. - Some locations that could experience flooding include... Hebron, Deshler, Chester, Hubbell and Gilead. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING
